conclusion: Understand the movement and interaction of objects A, B, C, D, E, and F.
Objects A and B are in the air, and objects C, D, E, and F are on the table.
Objects A and B are moved to the positions of C, D, E, and F respectively.
Objects A and B will come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F due to gravity.
Object A will be placed where object C is.
Object B will be placed where object F is.
Objects D and E will remain in their original positions.
Objects A and B will come into contact with objects C and F respectively due to gravity.
The final configuration will be as shown in Picture 3.
